original: Bendz, Stellan, civihngenjör, direktör, Halmstad, f. 9/11/98 i Malmö av adv. Reinhold B. o. Ella Hoffman. G. 1. 26 m. Ebba-Hililievid Flach, d. 43; 2. 45 m. Maj Siöström. translated: Bendz, Stellan, civil engineer, director, from Halmstad, born on November 9th, 1898 in Malmö, son of lawyer Reinhold B. and Ella Hoffman. Married 1st in 1926 to Ebba-Hililievid Flach, who died in 1943, and 2nd in 1945 to Maj Siöström. Children: Per-Olof born in 1927, Anita in 1928, Louise in 1930. He graduated from Malmö High School in 1916 and from the Royal Institute of Technology (specializing in shipping) in 1922. He resided on a scholarship in Germany and Holland in 1922 and worked in France and Italy in 1923 and in Finland in 1923-1924, as well as occasionally in the USA, Mexico, Canada, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Germany, Poland, Austria, Hungary, Slovakia, Yugoslavia, Italy, Switzerland, Spain, Portugal, France, Holland, Belgium, England, and Estonia. He was involved in construction and assembly in Sweden for A-B Herman's Ovens in Ingelstad from 1923 to 1925, as an inspector for Ford Motor Co. A-B in Stockholm from 1925 to 1927, as a managing director for Automobiles' Citroen in Stockholm from 1928 to 1930, in A-B Archimedes in Sundbyberg from 1930 to 1932, in Sueciaverkent Motor A-B and Sv. A-B Wayne in Malmö from 1932 to 1933, and in Verkst. A-B Haldex in Halmstad from 1933 onwards. He was a member of the city council from 1943 to 1946, a member of the board of examiners in Halland since 1941, chairman of the car valuation board in Halmstad since 1942, and a member of the war industry commission in Halland since 1944. He was also a member of the board of directors for Verkst. A-B Haldex, Taxam: Verkst. A-B in Stockholm, A-B Svetsmekano in Gothenburg, and Haida Dtd in London, chairman of the engineering association in Halmstad, a member of the board of trade in Halmstad, a member of the local scout promotion society, and a board member of the Rotary Club from 1945 onwards, and the Sällsk. W-6 in Halmstad. He was awarded the title of "Nordic Champion in Rowing" in 1915 and 1916, as well as the Swedish championship in rowing and ice skating many times between 1915 and 1922. His hobby was golf. He earned several honors, including the Medal of Merit from the Halmstad association, and the Swedish Rowing Association.
